title: 32-Element Stack Function Block
description:
RES_NI calculated the resistance of a NI-resistance sensor from the input
values T (temperature in°C) and R0 (resistance at 0°C).
The calculation is done using the formula:
RES_NI = R0 + A*T + B*T²+C*T4
A = 0.5485
B = 0.665E-3
C = 2.805E-9
The calculation is suitable for temperatures from -60.. +180 °C.
name: STACK_32

input.name: Din
input.description: The data value to be written to the stack.

input.name: E
input.description: Enable signal that allows the operation of the stack. If FALSE, the stack does not process read/write requests.

input.name: RD
input.description: Read request signal. When TRUE, an element will be read from the stack if it is not empty.

input.name: WD
input.description: Write request signal. When TRUE, the value of Din will be written to the stack if it is not full.

input.name: RST
input.description: Asynchronous reset signal. When TRUE, it resets the stack to its initial state.

output.name: Dout
output.description: The data value that has been read from the stack when RD is TRUE.

output.name: EMPTY
output.description: Indicates whether the stack is empty. TRUE if it is empty, FALSE otherwise.

output.name: FULL
output.description: Indicates whether the stack is full. TRUE if it is full, FALSE otherwise.
